xyz.acygn.mokapot

Class CopiableKnowledge<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.acygn.mokapot.ClassKnowledge<T>
      • xyz.acygn.mokapot.CopiableKnowledge<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The class that this knowledge is about.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UnreliablyCopiableKnowledge

    public class CopiableKnowledge<T>
extends ClassKnowledge<T>
    Knowledge about how to make a copy of objects of a given class. The resulting copy is, in marshalled form, an ObjectCopy object. It becomes a copy of the original object upon being unmarshalled.

    If an object of the class CopiableKnowledge itself is created, that represents that the class that object is about can be copied reliably. This does not apply to subclasses (that override unmarshalsReliably); see UnreliablyCopiableKnowledge in particular.

    Author:
    Alex Smith
    See Also:
    UnreliablyCopiableKnowledge

    • Method Detail

      • unmarshalsReliably

        public boolean unmarshalsReliably(boolean asField)
        Always returns true. This method should be overriden in subclasses where this is not the case, but unmarshalling reliably is the default for Copiable and effectively copiable objects.
        Specified by:
        unmarshalsReliably in class ClassKnowledge<T>
        Parameters:
        asField - Whether we're talking about a hypothetical object stored in a field of this class (true), or a class that inherits from or implements this class (false)
        Returns:
        true

      • unmarshalsAsCopy

        public boolean unmarshalsAsCopy()
        Always returns true. The whole point of this class is to use copy-based unmarshalling.
        Specified by:
        unmarshalsAsCopy in class ClassKnowledge<T>
        Returns:
        true.
